programme.title: Running with the Devil
Running with the Devil
programme.desc:
Running with the Devil: Directed by Jason Cabell. With Nicolas Cage, Laurence Fishburne, Leslie Bibb, Cole Hauser. The CEO of an international conglomerate sends two of his most regarded executives to investigate why shipments of cocaine are being hijacked and over cut somewhere on the supply chain." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5792656/","name":"Running with the Devil","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2JjZWU0MTUtZDNkMC00MmViLTg1MDAtNzI1OTNlODJhN2E3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTA1MDIxODk4._V1_.jpg","description":"The CEO of an international conglomerate sends two of his most regarded executives to investigate why shipments of cocaine are being hijacked and over cut somewhere on the supply chain.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5792656/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2019-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A documentary of the "do's and don'ts" of running your own cocaine empire","reviewBody":"Just kidding.

Newbie (only his second film) writer and director Jason Cabell is a former Navy Seal and inspired the story from true events. He did a decent job behind the camera and in directing his cast, but his writing certainly needed some tweaking. Some scenes were too long and others needed more information (e.g the dinner plate and it's people), so there were obvious plot and technical issues with his screenplay.

"Running with the Devil" is fascinating when dealing only with procedure, with Cabell capturing the machine of trafficking and its problematic participants, with a few unable to refuse an opportunity to sample the goods, either to satisfy themselves or impress others. Cabell doesn't craft a nail-biter, but there's underworld awareness here that gives the feature something different to do.

Double-crosses and hasty decisions return in the final act of "Running with the Devil," which becomes more formulaic as Cabell tries to figure out a way to tie up multiple subplots, with special concentration on The Man, who can't dig his way out of trouble, and The Agent in Charge, who understands the futility of enforcement, but can't quite give up the hunt. Cabell delivers some tepid turns of plot, though he does have a cast capable of making thin screenwriting come alive (Fishburne is having his fun here, and Bibb does well in dogged pursuit mode, and Cage is very fitting and convincing in his character), helping the viewing experience to a certain degree. No one will mistake "Running with the Devil" for a documentary of the "do's and don'ts" of running your own cocaine business, or on the global crisis, but Cabell doesn't completely commit to dramatic exaggeration, keeping observation alive for good stretch of the movie.

The pacing was quite good with a constant story non-stop, that the 100 min run-time breezed by quickly. The cinematography was on point, and the score decent.

It's a well deserved 8/10 from me."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":7395,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2019-09-20","keywords":"drug smuggling operation,drug overdose,child finds a corpse,child discovers a dead body,cocaine","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3143482393","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGM4MTA0YmYtMzI2MS00OTI2LThkYzQtYjkwNmJjN2MzZjdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGM4MTA0YmYtMzI2MS00OTI2LThkYzQtYjkwNmJjN2MzZjdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a cocaine shipment is compromised to the dismay of a drug cartel's CEO, known simply as The Boss, he orders his most trusted henchman, The Cook, and his partner, another master drug trafficker known as The Man, on a dangerous journey to audit the company's supply chain. As the drugs make their perilous trek across international borders, past gangsters, refiners, and couriers, they are also being tracked by Federal Agents. When The Cook realizes where the network is breaking down, it may be too late to keep the cartel satisfied."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000115/","name":"Nicolas Cage"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004753/","name":"Leslie Bibb"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5917942/","name":"Jason Cabell"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0083975/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0656537/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0725239/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5917942/","name":"Jason Cabell"}],"duration":"PT1H40M"}</script><metacontent="

Monster Hunter
programme.desc:
Monster Hunter: Directed by Paul W.S. Anderson. With Milla Jovovich, Tony Jaa, Ron Perlman, T.I.. When Cpt. Artemis and her loyal soldiers are transported to a new world, they engage in a desperate battle for survival against enormous enemies with incredible powers. Feature film based on the video game by Capcom." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6475714/","name":"Monster Hunter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU3NTFmNjYtODc3Ny00MWEzLWI3M2ItZjE3NDgwMTI0MzkzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"When Cpt. Feature film based on the video game by Capcom.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6475714/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dave-06306"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fun film ruined by the editing, again.","reviewBody":"As everyone else has mentioned its an fun monster adventure with a very likeable cast, plenty of action and decent effects.

But just like the last Resident Evil film its horribly over edited by director Paul W. S. Anderson and editor Doobie White who seem intent on using a style that nearly everyone in the audience hates.

A shame really, looks like they made a solid action monster movie and ruined it in Post.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":49223,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"based on video game,parallel world,female soldier,written by director,military","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi638763289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmEyM2JkN2ItNmQ3NS00ZTkzLWEwMjYtZmU1YmJlODczZWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmEyM2JkN2ItNmQ3NS00ZTkzLWEwMjYtZmU1YmJlODczZWM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"Behind our world, there is another: a world of dangerous and powerful monsters that rule their domain with deadly ferocity. When an unexpected sandstorm transports Captain Artemis (Milla Jovovich) and her unit (TI Harris, Meagan Good, Diego Boneta) to a new world, the soldiers are shocked to discover that this hostile and unknown environment is home to enormous and terrifying monsters immune to their firepower. In their desperate battle for survival, the unit encounters the mysterious Hunter (Tony Jaa), whose unique skills allow him to stay one step ahead of the powerful creatures. As Artemis and Hunter slowly build trust, she discovers that he is part of a team led by the Admiral (Ron Perlman). Facing a danger so great it could threaten to destroy their world, the brave warriors combine their unique abilities to band together for the ultimate showdown."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000170/","name":"Milla Jovovich"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1388074/","name":"Tony Jaa"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000579/","name":"Ron Perlman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0027271/","name":"Paul W.S. programme.desc: Step Up 2: The Streets: Directed by Jon M. Chu. With Briana Evigan, Robert Hoffman, Adam Sevani, Cassie Ventura. Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1023481/","name":"Step Up 2: The Streets","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc0NzYxOTgxOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTgxMjc1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Romantic sparks occur between two dance students from different backgrounds at the Maryland School of the Arts.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1023481/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"GibMart7"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Dancing Makes The Movie","reviewBody":"I actually thought that the movie was pretty good. It's not as bad as the reviews that it's getting, just don't go in expecting to get an Oscar performance. The storyline was a little all over the place. Typical teen dance movie. BUT the dancing is amazing couldn't keep my eyes off the screen. Robert Hoffman did a decent job, he really lays the charm in throughout the whole movie. The dance scenes make the entire movie. Ethnically, it is such a diverse cast of people, there is someone for everyone to identify with. The soundtrack is insanely good also. By the end of it you will be quoting lines and wanting to dance for sure.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":85707,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Music","Romance"],"datePublished":"2008-06-04","keywords":"dance off,dancing in the rain,dance movie,dance audition,dance crew","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Step Up 2 the Streets","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1253179673","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTAyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDMzNjAyMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MTAyOTYzM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDMzNjAyMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Step Up 2 the Streets Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1382207/","name":"Robert Hoffman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0263759/","name":"Briana Evigan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0144260/","name":"Cassie Ventura"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0160840/","name":"Jon M. programme.title: Chicken Run
Chicken Run – Hennen rennen
programme.desc: Chicken Run: Directed by Peter Lord, Nick Park. With Phil Daniels, Lynn Ferguson, Mel Gibson, Tony Haygarth. When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0120630/","name":"Chicken Run","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDgxNjZlZDYtZGJmZC00Mjg0LWEwYzctYWQ0MWFjNTM3ZmM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTM5NzI0NDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a cockerel apparently flies into a chicken farm, the chickens see him as an opportunity to escape their evil owners.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0120630/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Chrysanthepop"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Chicken Fun","reviewBody":"'Chicken Run' is a delighted little film about...well, chickens. I've always loved the claymation of Aardman. 'Creature Comforts' and 'Wallace and Gromit' are among many of my favorites. Aardman Studios have come up with a brilliant cast, a funny and smart script, fine cinematography and production design. The inspiration of films like 'The Great Escape' shows. The female characters are so strong and yet they have their own sense of humour and Brit-wit. Aardman's claymation is splendid. The large eyes, body size and shape and movements create this a unique class of comedy. The writing is very sharp and crisp but I disliked the obvious symbolism (of British and America joining hands to save the world and fight evil) which looked a little forced. I don't see the need to make the Rocky character an American rooster (as if it's an ingredient to have an American on board). Yet, that does not take away the sheer pleasure and entertainment one derives from the film. The voice cast is suitably chosen. Gibson plays the typical hero with charisma but it's the Brit cast, which includes names like Imelda Staunton, Lynn Ferguson, Jane Horrocks and Julia Sawalha that did it for me. Their sharp witty humour and strong will just put them on a league of their own. 'Chicken Run' is a cute, heartwarming, uplifting and hilarious little film. To quote another user, it is eggcellent!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":184254,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"G","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2000-06-23","keywords":"chicken,farm,escape,rooster,freedom","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Chicken Run","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2053636121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk5MjZkNGItMTcwYS00MTVhLTgxNTQtOGY3Mzk1YWNiYTQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk5MjZkNGItMTcwYS00MTVhLTgxNTQtOGY3Mzk1YWNiYTQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Universal Studios Home Entertainment"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0768018/","name":"Julia Sawalha"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0200057/","name":"Phil Daniels"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520485/","name":"Peter Lord"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661910/","name":"Nick Park"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103531/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0129164/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022869/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0520485/","name":"Peter Lord"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0661910/","name":"Nick Park"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0456732/","name":"Karey Kirkpatrick"}],"duration":"PT1H24M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Yogi Bear
Yogi Bär
programme.desc: Yogi Bear: Directed by Eric Brevig. With Dan Aykroyd, Justin Timberlake, Anna Faris, Tom Cavanagh. A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1302067/","name":"Yogi Bear","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMmI0ZmMwMDYtNTk4OC00NGNhLTk3NDUtNjFmZTI5NTUzYTFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTUyMzE4Mzg@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary filmmaker travels to Jellystone Park to shoot a project and soon crosses paths with Yogi Bear, his sidekick Boo-Boo and Ranger Smith.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1302067/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"JustAnEpicPerson"},"dateCreated":"2013-06-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A good 3D movie for the kids.","reviewBody":"Yogi Bear is about Jellystone Park about to get closed down because the town is bankrupt. Due to this, Ranger Smith (Tom Cavanagh) throws a party for Jellystone so more visitors come in, more visitors, more money. But Yogi screws it up. So now they must save the park somehow before it gets closed. Yogi (Dan Aykroyd) and Boo Boo (Justin Timberlake) do a good job at voice acting. Tom Cavanagh also does a good job, but everyone else does a bad job. ESPIALLY THE MAYOR (Andrew Daly) HE DOES NOT EVEN TRY. The 3D is pretty good, so if you have a Blu-ray 3D at home, try to rent this movie.\n\nOVERALL: It's funny, great 3D, and pretty good. programme.title: Vorstadtkrokodile
Vorstadtkrokodile
programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile: Directed by Christian Ditter. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0803100/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjA0NjA2NTU0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDY1NDY1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hannes wants to be a member of the crocodiles. To be a part of them he has to do something dangerous. When he is finally a member of them they experience dangerous adventures together.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0803100/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jannispetersen"},"dateCreated":"2009-03-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Beautiful and moving modern version!","reviewBody":"I didn't know what to expect of the filmatisation of the well-known German novel Vorstadtkrokodile. What I actually can remember is that when I read this novel as a child, I back then thought of, it would be great as a movie. So when I saw this movie is in the cinemas, I had to watch it. And I'm very glad to have done so! First of all the cast is great! Axel Stein does a really great job and also Semmelrogge is very funny in his short scene. I didn't know any of the youngsters, but all of them played their part very well - you instantly buy their roles the way they play them! And then there is the modernization of the context. Enormeausly well-done! Many nice gags, where I laughed out loud! This is a movie for everyone: the youngsters, young adults (like me, I'm in the middle of my twenties) and the elder generation! I hope you have read the novel, but if you haven't, I'm sure you are eager to do, after you watched this fantastic movie.\n\nHeck! I even caught myself gladly smiling at the very end!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-03-26","keywords":"first part,animal in title,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728894/","name":"Martin Ritzenhoff"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902149/","name":"Max von der Grün"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

What I actually can remember is that when I read this novel as a child, I back then thought of, it would be great as a movie. So when I saw this movie is in the cinemas, I had to watch it. And I'm very glad to have done so! First of all the cast is great! Axel Stein does a really great job and also Semmelrogge is very funny in his short scene. I didn't know any of the youngsters, but all of them played their part very well - you instantly buy their roles the way they play them! And then there is the modernization of the context. Enormeausly well-done! Many nice gags, where I laughed out loud! This is a movie for everyone: the youngsters, young adults (like me, I'm in the middle of my twenties) and the elder generation! I hope you have read the novel, but if you haven't, I'm sure you are eager to do, after you watched this fantastic movie.\n\nHeck! I even caught myself gladly smiling at the very end!","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1248,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1,"genre":["Adventure","Family"],"datePublished":"2009-03-26","keywords":"first part,animal in title,based on novel","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0728894/","name":"Martin Ritzenhoff","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0902149/","name":"Max von der Grün"],"duration":"PT1H38M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Vorstadtkrokodile 3
Vorstadtkrokodile 3
programme.desc: Vorstadtkrokodile 3: Directed by Wolfgang Groos. With Nick Romeo Reimann, Fabian Halbig, Leonie Tepe, Manuel Steitz. The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1692503/","name":"Vorstadtkrokodile 3","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc2NTAyNjY4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTMwMjA1NA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Crocodiles regroup and plan a prison break. It's an emergency and Frank needs his brother's help, but Denis sits in jail.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1692503/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kosmasp"},"dateCreated":"2021-07-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"One last time","reviewBody":"The kids are all grown up ... well they were not when this movie was made. Not entirely at least. Still a little bit older than when they started making them. So part 3 concludes their journey. And is as dramatic as they get. The inciting incident does not seem that big ... but turns out it is .. life an death and all that.\n\nHaving said that, the movie is still overall not riddled with heavy drama, even with that hanging over their heads, there is time for jealousy and other issues one might have growing up. We get our villains back from the first one, but this time around ... well we sort of hope they have grown up too ... not just physically but metaphorically speaking ... I reckon there is not too much mystery or things you'll be surprised will happen in the journey of the movie. Still a neat little movie that is mainly aimed at younger people.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":634,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2011-01-20","keywords":"boy in a wheelchair,overalls,stutterer,outtakes during end credits,working mom","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2180198/","name":"Nick Romeo Reimann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2526264/","name":"Fabian Halbig"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3036132/","name":"Leonie Tepe"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0343185/","name":"Wolfgang Groos"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0065798/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0035336/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0228542/","name":"Christian Ditter"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0046910/","name":"Thomas Bahmann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0381074/","name":"Ralf Hertwig"}],"duration":"PT1H21M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc: Ein Fall für TKKG: Drachenauge: Directed by Ulrich König. With Tomi Renjak, Max Sittel, Steffen Raddatz, Sanny van Heteren. The four young snoopers Tim, Karl, Kloesschen and Gaby by chance discover a hidden cave near an old castle. In it there's a board that seems to describe the way to a legendary sword. They ask their history teacher Schindler about it. He forbids them further actions, but secretly continues investigations with help of two ruthless criminals. programme.title: Konferenz der Tiere
Konferenz der Tiere
programme.desc:
Konferenz der Tiere: Directed by Reinhard Klooss, Holger Tappe. With James Corden, Stephen Fry, Andy Serkis, Dawn French. A group of animals waiting for the annual flood they rely on for food and water discover that the humans, who have been destroying their habitats have built a dam for a leisure resort." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1620449/","name":"Konferenz der Tiere","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNjE2Njc1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNDQ2NTk3Nw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of animals waiting for the annual flood they rely on for food and water discover that the humans, who have been destroying their habitats have built a dam for a leisure resort.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1620449/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"timothycrippins"},"dateCreated":"2011-01-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"Pollution in itself","reviewBody":"A film so bad it has forced me to spend time creating an IMDb account to warn others about it.

Animals United should not require a lengthy review or synopsis to achieve this aim. Despite being a feature clearly made for under 12s, the film has a brutal environmental and political agenda of breathtaking ambition. This is presented with so little nuance or charm that, despite all the perfectly good arguments for ecological action, you somehow despise the animals who star.

The plot is paper thin, chaotic and occasionally plain nonsense. For instance, the plot insists environmental conferences achieve nothing but a conference of animals which tails off into a juvenile eulogy for a fantasy world somehow inspires the action required. Not even my three year old niece fell for that level of reasoning.

Worst of all, I watched the entire film and, despite sharing the immediate area of the cinema with around twelve children of various ages, can honestly say they did not even smile once, let alone laugh. It is devoid of any entertainment value. I think you get the point.

I wonder how the makers of this film can live with the amount of energy being wasted to give it distribution...","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":1}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6383,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2010-10-07","keywords":"father daughter relationship,hero,heroine,fire,rabbit","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Animals United","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi162440473","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJiYWE5ZTctNjUyZS00YmJjLWExNjktOWRhNTgzMDgwM2RiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjJiYWE5ZTctNjUyZS00YmJjLWExNjktOWRhNTgzMDgwM2RiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Animals United"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179479/","name":"James Corden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000410/","name":"Stephen Fry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0785227/","name":"Andy Serkis"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0459996/","name":"Reinhard Klooss"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1637852/","name":"Holger Tappe"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0118168/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0234654/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380835/","name":"Simon Hauschild"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1075038/","name":"Oliver Huzly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0459996/","name":"Reinhard Klooss"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
Gullivers Reisen – Da kommt was Grosses auf uns zu
programme.desc:
Gulliver's Travels: Directed by Rob Letterman. With Jack Black, Jason Segel, Emily Blunt, Amanda Peet. Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320261/","name":"Gulliver's Travels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NTUwOTM3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA3NjIwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CrashRaindog"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"I really wish I could unwatch this film","reviewBody":"As a fan of the original work, which was a satire on the political climate at the time of it's writing, this dire pile of Follywood dross is so far removed from any idea contained within the book it came from that it may as well not be so titled.

Jack Black is beginning to become pretty tiresome in the role he's adopted in most of the films he's appeared in, his appeal is wearing thin. Unless he finds a new direction and follows it, I don't see him being that popular for very much longer, certainly not with people with an IQ greater than their show size at any rate.

I'm appalled that this pathetic attempt at a retelling of a classic tale has been allowed to be passed off as something worth spending money on. In true Hollywood style it is vacuous and totally formulaic to the point that I could predict most of the film. I didn't even bother watching the end as I had better things to do, such as scraping out the oven with my teeth.

I really do wish I could unwatch this terrible film, it didn't even try that hard. The people responsible for this travesty must really think very little of their audience."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-12-29","keywords":"reference to gulliver's travels,reference to gulliver,gulliver,close up of eye,close up of eyes","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gulliver's Travels - Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2625476889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shipwrecked travel writer Lemuel Gulliver (Black) finds himself transported to an island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle, where he's a giant among the natives, the Lilliputians. Initially taken prisoner, Gulliver becomes a favorite of the court and schemes for a way in which the Lilliputians can outwith their rivals, the Blefuscudians."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1289434/","name":"Emily Blunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781981/","name":"Jason Segel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0842605/","name":"Jonathan Swift"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
Der Kaufhaus Cop 2
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"More of the same","reviewBody":"Although the original "Paul Blart: Mall Cop" was a box office hit, I don't think anyone was exactly clamouring for a sequel. But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Kids (YOUNG kids) might find the humor to be funny, but I think other adults like myself will sit in silence like I did. Is there anything of merit to be found in the movie? Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2263115/","name":"Raini Rodriguez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0895150/","name":"Eduardo Verástegui"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0275698/","name":"Andy Fickman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0479739/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre
Asterix und Obelix: Mission Kleopatra
programme.desc: Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre: Directed by Alain Chabat. With Gérard Depardieu, Christian Clavier, Jamel Debbouze, Monica Bellucci. Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0250223/","name":"Astérix & Obélix: Mission Cléopâtre","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2Q3NmUzNjAtM2VjMS00MGU3LWE4YjEtZTM1NDM0YTdlOWRkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODIyOTEyMzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Astérix and Obélix go to Egypt to help architect Numérobis who is building a palace for Cleopatra.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0250223/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"dbdumonteil"},"dateCreated":"2002-11-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"they're crazy those Romans!","reviewBody":"In 1995, the movie "le hussard sur le toit" was released and it had a record; it was the most expensive movie ever made. This record was beaten seven years later with this film. But once again, this enormous budget was worth to be spending. Alain Chabat controls perfectly the huge incomes to his disposition (for example, sceneries are carefully restored and the crowd movements are wide) and he succeeds in recreating the fanciful atmosphere of the Astérix'albums. His making is very inventive, full of clever visuals and ringing brainwaves. Moreover, he doesn't only emphasize on the special effects of the movie and this was one of the faults of the first Astérix' film made by Claude Zidi in 1999. On the other hand, what a casting! It's very similar to the Sacha Guitry's film "si Versailles m'étais conté" and you can have fun by guessing which actor epitomize which character of the album "Astérix et Cléopâtre". As far as Christian Clavier and Gérard Depardieu are concerned, they're better managed than in the Zidi's film: they don't ham it up and are more credible in their respective roles even if Depardieu isn't fat enough. The other actors are excellent, (especially Gérard Darmon) rightly chosen even the minor actors in whom Chabat grants a big importance. Nevertheless, this one doesn't fit in the Caesar's role: he is a bit listless and not authoritarian enough. At last, let's notice that the characters' names are successful and funny puns (Menubestofplus, Numérobis, Itinéris), but they're only easily understood for French people. At the end, a successful adaptation of the Astérix's comic strip on the screen and a pleasant entertainment."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":51219,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2002-01-30","keywords":"architect,based on comic book,egypt,druid,cleopatra","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1979890201","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BM2YyNTIxYzAtYzg2Yi00YzAyLThmYWEtOGQwYWJmZWU4MjM0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000367/","name":"Gérard Depardieu"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002010/","name":"Christian Clavier"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0213354/","name":"Jamel Debbouze"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028557/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0090290/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049807/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0331453/","name":"René Goscinny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0879853/","name":"Albert Uderzo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0149260/","name":"Alain Chabat"}],"duration":"PT1H47M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
Jumanji: Willkommen im Dschungel
programme.desc:
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle: Directed by Jake Kasdan. With Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Jack Black, Karen Gillan. Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2283362/","name":"Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ0NDhjYWItYTMxZi00NTk2LWIzNDEtOWZiYWYxZjc2MTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2283362/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"veeresh1209"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A movie with power packed smoldering intensity","reviewBody":"Reboots can be tricky. While some click, most of them crumble under the pressure to shake off the barrage of comparisons that would be thrown at the movie. Last couple of years saw such horrible reboots like Jurassic World, The Mummy, Kong: Skull Island. But much like Spiderman: Homecoming, Jumanji succeeds to impress the viewers. Jumanji gets a modern age makeover where now instead of a board game it is a video game. Four teenagers with varying personalities are put together in a detention. Here they discover the Jumanji video game and enter the world of Jumanji as their avatars. Then starts the fun ride. There are enough plot holes like how did the video game end up in a high school from Alex's freak house. The movie uses time tested cliche - Four teenagers with some flaw realize their shortcomings when (literally) seen from some other's point of view. But the fun parts of the movie makes us forget them, at least till the movie ends.

The movie does not take itself seriously, and that is a huge plus point. The plot of the movie is crazy, there are man eating albino (what?!) rhinos on one side and villainous henchmen with crazy mud racing bike skills on the other side. But such craziness has been ridiculed in the movie itself, which makes you fall in love with it more.

The bigger plus for the movie has been the performance of the lead actors. All of them have created niche for themselves in the film industry. Jumanji has used such niche beautifully and built very funny characters. Parts where Dwayne Johnson(Spencer) stops to admire his own physique will have you in splits. Not to mention his hilarious display of 'smoldering intensity'. Kevin Hart is Kevin Hart and Jack Blake as a women in a man's body is perfect. Karen Gillan, who is this mean Nebula in MCU, comes up with a very charming performance.

All in all, Jumanji is a movie that you can watch without any regret. It will make you gasp, wonder and laugh hysterically. It is definitely worth a watch.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":348689,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2017-12-20","keywords":"jungle,trapped in a game,title based on song,song in title,high school","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3413817625","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUxNzE5MDI1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAwNzE2MzI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODUxNzE5MDI1NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTAwNzE2MzI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers discover an old video game console and are literally drawn into the game's jungle setting becoming the adult avatars they choose."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0425005/","name":"Dwayne Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2394794/","name":"Karen Gillan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0366389/","name":"Kevin Hart"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0440458/","name":"Jake Kasdan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0332017/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0571344/","name":"Chris McKenna"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1273099/","name":"Erik Sommers"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0003298/","name":"Scott Rosenberg"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.desc:
A Dog's Journey: Directed by Gail Mancuso. With Josh Gad, Dennis Quaid, Kathryn Prescott, Marg Helgenberger. A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8385474/","name":"A Dog's Journey","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRhMWY0ODMtMmM3OC00ZGRmLWIyZjktZGQ0ZGE4MzcyZWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8385474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gwmbkm"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Wonderful Sequel to "A Dog's Purpose"","reviewBody":"Audiences need more movies like this one!

My husband and I went to a 4 PM weekday show as we needed to "kill" a few hours before meeting our daughter. We knew it was the same writer (W. Bruce Cameron) as two other movies we loved ("A Dog's Purpose" and "A Dog's Way Home") but we didn't know it was a sequel to "A Dog's Purpose." If you haven't seen "A Dog's Purpose" I'd strongly suggest you do so before seeing "A Dog's Journey." You'll enjoy the continuing saga of Bailey and his people much more if you do.

Prepare to cry.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22410,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-05-16","keywords":"sequel,second part,animal in title,apostrophe in title,punctuation in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi722450969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg1MTU4NWMtZGM2OC00OWUyLWI4MzktZTA2ZDQ2Yjc4MjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg1MTU4NWMtZGM2OC00OWUyLWI4MzktZTA2ZDQ2Yjc4MjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Bailey finds his new purpose. programme.title: Gulliver's Travels
Gullivers Reisen – Da kommt was Grosses auf uns zu
programme.desc:
Gulliver's Travels: Directed by Rob Letterman. With Jack Black, Jason Segel, Emily Blunt, Amanda Peet. Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1320261/","name":"Gulliver's Travels","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU0NTUwOTM3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDA3NjIwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Travel writer Lemuel Gulliver takes an assignment in Bermuda but ends up on the island of Lilliput, where he towers over its tiny citizens.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1320261/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"CrashRaindog"},"dateCreated":"2011-08-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"I really wish I could unwatch this film","reviewBody":"As a fan of the original work, which was a satire on the political climate at the time of it's writing, this dire pile of Follywood dross is so far removed from any idea contained within the book it came from that it may as well not be so titled.

Jack Black is beginning to become pretty tiresome in the role he's adopted in most of the films he's appeared in, his appeal is wearing thin. Unless he finds a new direction and follows it, I don't see him being that popular for very much longer, certainly not with people with an IQ greater than their show size at any rate.

I'm appalled that this pathetic attempt at a retelling of a classic tale has been allowed to be passed off as something worth spending money on. In true Hollywood style it is vacuous and totally formulaic to the point that I could predict most of the film. I didn't even bother watching the end as I had better things to do, such as scraping out the oven with my teeth.

I really do wish I could unwatch this terrible film, it didn't even try that hard. The people responsible for this travesty must really think very little of their audience."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":68102,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Family"],"datePublished":"2010-12-29","keywords":"reference to gulliver's travels,reference to gulliver,gulliver,close up of eye,close up of eyes","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Gulliver's Travels - Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2625476889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1MzQyMjA4MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMzUwMDYwNA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Shipwrecked travel writer Lemuel Gulliver (Black) finds himself transported to an island in the middle of the Bermuda Triangle, where he's a giant among the natives, the Lilliputians. Initially taken prisoner, Gulliver becomes a favorite of the court and schemes for a way in which the Lilliputians can outwith their rivals, the Blefuscudians."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0085312/","name":"Jack Black"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1289434/","name":"Emily Blunt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0781981/","name":"Jason Segel"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1224299/","name":"Rob Letterman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0174373/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0022730/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0830294/","name":"Joe Stillman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0831557/","name":"Nicholas Stoller"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0842605/","name":"Jonathan Swift"}],"duration":"PT1H25M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop
Der Kaufhaus Cop
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski"},"dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1114740, Title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop, --- Description: Paul Blart: Mall Cop: Directed by Steve Carr. With Kevin James, Keir O'Donnell, Jayma Mays, Raini Rodriguez. When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1114740/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTM2NzA1MzE1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwOTYyNDIzMg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is taken over by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1114740/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"peterkowalski","dateCreated":"2009-02-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Almost painful...","reviewBody":"When I saw the trailer for this movie, I was more than anxious to see it. Then I saw another one and it made me see it even more. Then I saw the movie and guess what, all the good scenes were those that I've already seen and nothing more. The idea itself is a very interesting one at very least, but it's the realization is where the movie fails. The story begins to borderline on being boring halfway through, and it all begins to be more than predictable. Once or twice the story takes an engaging turn, but it's really not enough. The funny parts are to be counted on the fingers of one hand, and the ending is -again- so predictable, it hurts. Which is a shame, because the acting is really good, Kevin James is truly shining through and proving that he's a really good actor; again, not nearly enough to salvage the shortcomings of the plot and the lack of jokes. Which is a shame. Movie starts really promising, but the further we go into the movie, the more painful it becomes to watch it. As if the makers gave up on it after shooting the first 30 minutes. I'm giving it 5 stars only because the first half an hour is really decent. And I gotta admire James doing all his stunts. So do yourself a favor. Don't watch the movie. Watch the trailers. That's all you need to see.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":107148,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2,"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2009-04-15","keywords":"mall cop,reference to scooby doo,single father,die hard scenario,comic violence","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"DVD Trailer: Paul Blart: Mall Cop","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1000931865","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI5ODYwNzIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTA5MjU1Mg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When a shopping mall is overtaken by a gang of organized crooks, it's up to the a mild-mannered security guard to save the day.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1218757/","name":"Keir O'Donnell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1724323/","name":"Jayma Mays"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139867/","name":"Steve Carr"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059609/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048169/","name":"Nick Bakay"],"duration":"PT1H31M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2
Der Kaufhaus Cop 2
programme.desc: Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2: Directed by Andy Fickman. With Kevin James, Raini Rodriguez, Neal McDonough, Daniella Alonso. After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart answers." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3450650/","name":"Paul Blart: Mall Cop 2","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTkwMjkxNDQ1MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNDQwODIxNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Las Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. But safety never takes a holiday and when duty calls, Blart a","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3450650/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Wizard-8"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"More of the same","reviewBody":"Although the original "Paul Blart: Mall Cop" was a box office hit, I don't think anyone was exactly clamouring for a sequel. But here one is, and it's pretty much like the first movie, namely that it's a comic take on the formula the action movie "Die Hard" gave birth to. While there are a handful of gags that this adult did find to be (mildly) amusing, the humor for the most part is simple-minded and lame, with a number of gags recycled from the first movie. Kids (YOUNG kids) might find the humor to be funny, but I think other adults like myself will sit in silence like I did. Is there anything of merit to be found in the movie? Well, Kevin James does bring in an instant likability, like he did in the first movie. But he really needs someone else to write his material. And the movie looks great, with expert photography and lighting that makes the colors pop out of your television set. So if your kids insist on dragging you to see this movie with them, make sure you get the Blu-ray disc."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":36206,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.4},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2015-04-16","keywords":"2010s,security,guard,security guard,black","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4079988249","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjAwNzk0NTE3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODgwMTUzNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"After six years of keeping our malls safe, Paul Blart has earned a well-deserved vacation. He heads to Vegas with his teenage daughter before she heads off to college. programme.desc:
A Dog's Journey: Directed by Gail Mancuso. With Josh Gad, Dennis Quaid, Kathryn Prescott, Marg Helgenberger. A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8385474/","name":"A Dog's Journey","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRhMWY0ODMtMmM3OC00ZGRmLWIyZjktZGQ0ZGE4MzcyZWE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzc5MjA3OA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A dog finds the meaning of his own existence through the lives of the humans he meets.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8385474/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"gwmbkm"},"dateCreated":"2019-05-26","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Wonderful Sequel to "A Dog's Purpose"","reviewBody":"Audiences need more movies like this one!

My husband and I went to a 4 PM weekday show as we needed to "kill" a few hours before meeting our daughter. We knew it was the same writer (W. Bruce Cameron) as two other movies we loved ("A Dog's Purpose" and "A Dog's Way Home") but we didn't know it was a sequel to "A Dog's Purpose." If you haven't seen "A Dog's Purpose" I'd strongly suggest you do so before seeing "A Dog's Journey." You'll enjoy the continuing saga of Bailey and his people much more if you do.

Prepare to cry.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":22410,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.5},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-05-16","keywords":"sequel,second part,animal in title,apostrophe in title,punctuation in title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi722450969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg1MTU4NWMtZGM2OC00OWUyLWI4MzktZTA2ZDQ2Yjc4MjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDg1MTU4NWMtZGM2OC00OWUyLWI4MzktZTA2ZDQ2Yjc4MjA2XkEyXkFqcGdeQWpnYW1i._V1_.jpg","description":"Bailey finds his new purpose. programme.title: Sams in Gefahr
Sams in Gefahr
programme.desc:
Sams in Gefahr: Directed by Ben Verbong. With Ulrich Noethen, Christine Urspruch, Dominique Horwitz, Armin Rohde." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0372504/","name":"Sams in Gefahr","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3NDQ2Njg1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjE2Mzk1MTE@._V1_.jpg","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0372504/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"missmarmite"},"dateCreated":"2004-07-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"They didn't keep their promise, I'm afraid","reviewBody":"I can't remember if I read something or if I heard or saw an interview, somewhere the author and/ or the producer of Sams (the first film) said, if they are going to do a second one, they will take care and make it good, the same quality as the first film, because they don't want to do a second film just for the money.

So far, so good.

Last week I watched "Sams in Gefahr" on DVD. What shall I say... they didn't quite keep their promise, I'm afraid. The film is funny, full of action, good ideas, nicely set again in Bamberg, some great new characters, but...

The biggest mistake was to replace Aglaia Szyszkowitz. Full stop.

About the rest, the film just doesn't work the same way the first one did. Everything in the first was new, the Sams itself, the way it makes wishes come true, the way they have to be wished, the way Herr Taschenbier is treated by people around him and so on. Everything was a novelty.

Now with the second film all this is old news. We know now how all this works. To simply repeat it in a different manner or more or at a bigger scale, doesn't work. It works for people who haven't seen the first film, but who hasn't? The second film should have offered something new again. I don't know what, but something. But not a new Frau Taschenbier, that is for sure.

I know, I'm an adult and children still might like this film very much and fall of their seats because they laugh so hard, but still. They didn't quite keep their promise, if you look closer. 5 out of 10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":344,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2},"genre":["Family"],"datePublished":"2003-12-11","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0633947/","name":"Ulrich Noethen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0882162/","name":"Christine Urspruch"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395850/","name":"Dominique Horwitz"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893676/","name":"Ben Verbong"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102397/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0530956/","name":"Paul Maar"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510789/","name":"Ulrich Limmer"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

With Ulrich Noethen, Christine Urspruch, Dominique Horwitz, Armin Rohde." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0372504/","name":"Sams in Gefahr","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3NDQ2Njg1NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjE2Mzk1MTE@._V1_.jpg","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0372504/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"missmarmite","dateCreated":"2004-07-08","inLanguage":"English","name":"They didn't keep their promise, I'm afraid","reviewBody":"I can't remember if I read something or if I heard or saw an interview, somewhere the author and/ or the producer of Sams (the first film) said, if they are going to do a second one, they will take care and make it good, the same quality as the first film, because they don't want to do a second film just for the money.

So far, so good.

Last week I watched "Sams in Gefahr" on DVD. What shall I say... they didn't quite keep their promise, I'm afraid. The film is funny, full of action, good ideas, nicely set again in Bamberg, some great new characters, but...

The biggest mistake was to replace Aglaia Szyszkowitz. Full stop.

About the rest, the film just doesn't work the same way the first one did. Everything in the first was new, the Sams itself, the way it makes wishes come true, the way they have to be wished, the way Herr Taschenbier is treated by people around him and so on. Everything was a novelty.

Now with the second film all this is old news. We know now how all this works. To simply repeat it in a different manner or more or at a bigger scale, doesn't work. It works for people who haven't seen the first film, but who hasn't? The second film should have offered something new again. I don't know what, but something. But not a new Frau Taschenbier, that is for sure.

I know, I'm an adult and children still might like this film very much and fall of their seats because they laugh so hard, but still. They didn't quite keep their promise, if you look closer. 5 out of 10.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":344,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.2,"genre":["Family"],"datePublished":"2003-12-11","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0633947/","name":"Ulrich Noethen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0882162/","name":"Christine Urspruch","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0395850/","name":"Dominique Horwitz"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0893676/","name":"Ben Verbong"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102397/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002257/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0530956/","name":"Paul Maar","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0510789/","name":"Ulrich Limmer"],"duration":"PT1H36M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle
Jumanji: Willkommen im Dschungel
programme.desc:
Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle: Directed by Jake Kasdan. With Dwayne Johnson, Kevin Hart, Jack Black, Karen Gillan. Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2283362/","name":"Jumanji: Welcome to the Jungle","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODQ0NDhjYWItYTMxZi00NTk2LWIzNDEtOWZiYWYxZjc2MTgxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four teenagers are sucked into a magical video game, and the only way they can escape is to work together to finish the game.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2283362/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"veeresh1209"},"dateCreated":"2018-04-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A movie with power packed smoldering intensity","reviewBody":"Reboots can be tricky. While some click, most of them crumble under the pressure to shake off the barrage of comparisons that would be thrown at the movie. Last couple of years saw such horrible reboots like Jurassic World, The Mummy, Kong: Skull Island. But much like Spiderman: Homecoming, Jumanji succeeds to impress the viewers. Jumanji gets a modern age makeover where now instead of a board game it is a video game. Four teenagers with varying personalities are put together in a detention. Here they discover the Jumanji video game and enter the world of Jumanji as their avatars. Then starts the fun ride. There are enough plot holes like how did the video game end up in a high school from Alex's freak house. The movie uses time tested cliche - Four teenagers with some flaw realize their shortcomings when (literally) seen from some other's point of view. But the fun parts of the movie makes us forget them, at least till the movie ends.

The movie does not take itself seriously, and that is a huge plus point. The plot of the movie is crazy, there are man eating albino (what?!) rhinos on one side and villainous henchmen with crazy mud racing bike skills on the other side. But such craziness has been ridiculed in the movie itself, which makes you fall in love with it more.

The bigger plus for the movie has been the performance of the lead actors. All of them have created niche for themselves in the film industry. Jumanji has used such niche beautifully and built very funny characters. Parts where Dwayne Johnson(Spencer) stops to admire his own physique will have you in splits. Not to mention his hilarious display of 'smoldering intensity'. Kevin Hart is Kevin Hart and Jack Blake as a women in a man's body is perfect. Karen Gillan, who is this mean Nebula in MCU, comes up with a very charming performance.

All in all, Jumanji is a movie that you can watch without any regret. It will make you gasp, wonder and laugh hysterically.
